title: Associative thinking at the core of creativity

annotations.text: According to the associative theory of creativity, what distinguishes more creative people is their capacity for association, i.e., making new connections between seemingly unrelated concepts stored in memory.
A higher creative person has connections of similar strength between both common and uncommon concepts, facilitating the bypass of conventional associations to make novel/remote associations.
The associative theory has received mixed empirical support, largely due to challenges in representing semantic memory structure.

title: The Small World of Words English word association norms
authors: De Deyne, Navarro, Perfors, Brysbaert & Storms

annotations.text: Word association patterns exhibit stable individual differences across over 12,000 cue words.
